instance_text.source: One day, a man and his wife were trying to find a place that was shallow and without pollution to cultivate. They were poor; they didn't have the necessary resources, but the husband worked so hard because his wife had had an accident. It happened one day that his wife was working on a campaign for the conservation of endangered animals. She went to a place in search of animals. She heard a sound in a dark place in the jungle, so she went to investigate what that was. A creature that had never been seen attack her. Her partner only heard a shout and they found Lucy, the wife of the man, on the floor. They asked her if she was OK, but she didn't answer, so her partner took her to the doctor. There, the doctor said that she was OK but she would never hear again unless she paid 1, 000 dollars for an operation.
instance_text.corrected: One day, a man and his wife were trying to find a place that was shallow and without pollution to cultivate. They were poor; they didn't have the necessary resources, but the husband worked so hard because his wife had had an accident. It happened one day that his wife was working on a campaign for the conservation of endangered animals. She went to a place in search of animals. She heard a sound in a dark place in the jungle, so she went to investigate what that was. A creature that had never been seen attacked her. Her partner only heard a shout and they found Lucy, the wife of the man, on the floor. They asked her if she was OK, but she didn't answer, so her partner took her to the doctor. There, the doctor said that she was OK but she would never hear again unless she paid 1, 000 dollars for an operation.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the simple past to talk about an action or occurrence in the past.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "attack" to its past tense form.

instance_text.source: Your thoughts are the only ones that will make the difference, so take care only of them and believe in yourself so you could achieve the prestige you're looking for.

instance_text.source: Suddenly two people dressed as astronauts were leaving the park and warned the young boys to go to their house and wait until this unfortunately event was over.

instance_text.source: I do believe that people's lives in the future will change for the bad.

For instance, it can be a cost - effective way to get to work. So, will there be no place for public transport in the future?

instance_text.source: My town makes great efforts to take care of the environment. They have put many bins in the streets to keep it clean and they prevent private transport on many days to keep the air clean. They plant trees to absorb co2 and release oxygen, they build factories away from the houses of citizens to prevent the respiratory diseases which is a result of air pollution from factories. So, not only my country itself but also individuals follow a proper procedure to keep the environment clean.

They have put many bins in the streets to keep it clean and they prevent private transport on many days to keep the air clean. They plant trees to absorb co2 and release oxygen, they build factories away from the houses of citizens to prevent the respiratory diseases which are a result of air pollution from factories. So, not only my country itself but also individuals follow a proper procedure to keep the environment clean.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The "be" verb here is linked by the relative pronoun "which" to the subject, "respiratory diseases," which is third-person plural.

instance_text.source: I had been learning English for the last six months.

instance_text.source: First, when I was on the starting line, I felt I could not finish the competition. I was so excited to see our families waiting for us, clapping and shouting loudly every time one of us arrived.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the preposition "with" to link the method or means "new exotic cuisines" to the action "experimenting."

instance_text.source: Not to mention the social bonding ability of it, while game tension between the opposing teams is somewhat inevitable, the irreverent, human, no - strings - attached nature of streetball events always compensate [NONE] its negative aspects which, upon closer inspection, appear to be shared between every single sports event.
instance_text.corrected: Not to mention the social bonding ability of it, while game tension between the opposing teams is somewhat inevitable, the irreverent, human, no - strings - attached nature of streetball events always compensate for its negative aspects which, upon closer inspection, appear to be shared between every single sports event.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the word "for" to link a noun or noun-phrase purpose to the verb "compensate."

instance_text.source: Everyone is terrified and find out that a demon is attached to the doll.
instance_text.corrected: Everyone is terrified and finds out that a demon is attached to the doll.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject "everyone" is singular, and therefore the third-person singular form of the verb is required.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "find" to its third-person singular form.

instance_text.source: Being raised in an environment where personal autonomy is the core, children with disabilities were growing [NONE] very independent and strong, despite all the challenges they could face along the way.
instance_text.corrected: Being raised in an environment where personal autonomy is the core, children with disabilities were growing up very independent and strong, despite all the challenges they could face along the way.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You seem to be thinking of the phrasal verb "grow up."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add the word "up" here to create the phrasal verb "grow up."

instance_text.source: I was so angry, because I was finishing the puzzles and five pieces were missing. So I began to search the whole house for the five pieces but didn't find them.
instance_text.corrected: I was so angry, because I was finishing the puzzle and five pieces were missing. So I began to search the whole house for the five pieces but didn't find them.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You seem to be talking about only one "puzzle."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "puzzles" to its singular form.

instance_text.source: To solve this problem, the city should set up more space and facilities for skateboarding, and separate the different space for walking and skateboarding.
instance_text.corrected: To solve this problem, the city should set up more space and facilities for skateboarding, and separate the different spaces for walking and skateboarding.

feedback.feedback_explanation: While "space" can be uncountable in certain situations, you seem to be talking about multiple places. The meaning of the word "space" can be counted.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "space" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: One day in the morning, Paxton waited for Long and the writer, but he heard that someone was calling him. Suddenly, he goes to the beach and is killed by the shadow.
instance_text.corrected: One day in the morning, Paxton was waiting for Long and the writer, but he heard that someone was calling him. Suddenly, he goes to the beach and is killed by the shadow.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the past continuous to talk about an event or action in the past that was continuing at the time you are talking about.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "waited" to its past continous form.

instance_text.source: The second problem is about that some apparatus are not working well because the school didn't maintenance a since long time ago.
instance_text.corrected: The second problem is about that some apparatus are not working well because the school hasn't done maintenance a since long time ago.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the present perfect tense to talk about an event or action that took place in the past but has a continuing or lasting effect now.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "didn't" to the perfective form of "do."

instance_text.source: Everyone's nervous except for Jerome Tanny, last year's champion, famous for his threatening pre - start grin, that we all call [NONE] 'Shark's Smile'.
instance_text.corrected: Everyone's nervous except for Jerome Tanny, last year's champion, famous for his threatening pre - start grin, that we all call the 'Shark's Smile'.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When referring to a special or particular thing or instance, use the determiner "the" to mark it.

instance_text.source: Only possible in segmental pronunciation, the occasional missed a few notes, such as -d, I did not noticed this because when I deliberately stressed -d, I found the tone and mood more likely to become very weird. This is the biggest problem I've encountered in pronunciation teaching.
instance_text.corrected: Only possible in segmental pronunciation, the occasional missed a few notes, such as -d, I did not notice this because when I deliberately stressed -d, I found the tone and mood more likely to become very weird. This is the biggest problem I've encountered in pronunciation teaching.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When making a negative statement that uses the helping verb "do", regardless of tense, the verb should be reduced to its base form.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "noticed" to its base form.

instance_text.source: Now, to answer your question, I have many favourite places near my town because I live in a lovely little town, but there is one place that is special for me: 'A Fervenza do Pedregal'. '
instance_text.corrected: Now, to answer your question, I have many favourite places near my town because I live in a lovely little town, but there is one place that is special to me: 'A Fervenza do Pedregal'. '

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "special" takes the word "to" when indicating who finds the subject special.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "for" to the word "to."

instance_text.source: But, the fact that it is short distance doesn't mean it will be easy or something like that.
instance_text.corrected: But, the fact that it is short distance doesn't mean it will be easy or anything like that.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "something" is not the correct quantifier to negate the entirety of the predicate in a negative sentence.
feedback.highlight_text: doesn't mean it will be easy or something

instance_text.source: Our flat and houses make the other animals lose their homes, and it leads to environmental deterioration.
instance_text.corrected: Our flats and houses make the other animals lose their homes, and it leads to environmental deterioration.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You seem to be talking about more than one "flat," so the plural form is required.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "flat" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: That being said, I still feel the reasons I have presented are strong ones, such as architecture and computer system.
instance_text.corrected: That being said, I still feel the reasons I have presented are strong ones, such as architecture and computer systems.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Although "system" can be a collective noun in that it contains many pieces, you seem to be referring to more than one collection of pieces. In this case, "system" is a countable noun.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "system" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: This is the result that something new has occurred and they want to collect information.
instance_text.corrected: This is because something new has occurred and they want to collect information.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When explaining a cause in the current sentence that has an effect explained in a previous sentence, use the phrase "this is because" to refer to the previous sentence.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the phrase "the result that" to the word "because."

instance_text.source: To begin with is design, we have to considerate background colour, artwork, and security issues, and then we are supposed to prepare metal plates, using skilled machinists.
instance_text.corrected: To begin with is design, we have to consider background colour, artwork, and security issues, and then we are supposed to prepare metal plates, using skilled machinists.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "considerate" is an adjective, but it is in a verb position here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "considerate" to its verb form.

instance_text.source: My favourite restaurant is situated in Modugno.
instance_text.corrected: My favourite restaurant is [NONE] in Modugno.

feedback.feedback_explanation: To tell where something is located, use a be verb and an appropriate preposition.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Remove the word "situated" as it is not necessary to explain location.

instance_text.source: These were my first feeling when I made the mistake.
instance_text.corrected: These were my first feelings when I made the mistake.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You seem to be talking about more than one "feeling," so you need the plural form here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "feeling" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: We took all we needed and started the searching for Niall... We went to all the caves in Los Angeles, but we couldn't find them.
instance_text.corrected: We took all we needed and started the search for Niall... We went to all the caves in Los Angeles, but we couldn't find them.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "search" can be used as a noun here and does not require the gerund form.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "searching" to its base form.

instance_text.source: Right after getting off the plane, she traveled to his dorm to meet him with a view to satisfying her long waiting for him.
instance_text.corrected: Right after getting off the plane, she traveled to his dorm to meet him with a view to satisfying her long wait for him.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "wait" is already a noun, and does not require its gerund form here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "waiting" to its base form.

instance_text.source: I've been living in Augsburg for nearly two years now and am studying for a B.A. [NONE] Anglistik and economics.
instance_text.corrected: I've been living in Augsburg for nearly two years now and am studying for a B.A. in Anglistik and economics.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The preposition "in" is used to show what major or field a degree is focused on.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "in" after "B.A." to connect it to the fields.

instance_text.source: It became a big problem now.
instance_text.corrected: It has become a big problem now.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When talking about something that happened in the past and has an effect now, it is necessary to use the present perfect tense (have/has + past participle of the verb).

instance_text.source: Secondly, the student who has a good body shape can easily make new friends, and joining a sports team allows students to maintain [NONE] good body shape.
instance_text.corrected: Secondly, the student who has a good body shape can easily make new friends, and joining a sports team allows students to maintain a good body shape.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Good body shape" is a singular, countable noun, so it needs an article. It is not specific, so the indefinite article "a" is correct.

instance_text.source: One day, a man and his wife were trying to find a place that was shallow and without pollution to cultivate. They were poor; they didn't have the necessary resources, but the husband worked so hard because his wife had had an accident. It happened one day that his wife was working on a campaign for the conservation of endangered animals. She went to a place in search of animals. She heard a sound in a dark place in the jungle, so she went to investigate what that was. A creature that had never been seen attack her. Her partner only heard a shout and they found Lucy, the wife of the man, on the floor. They asked her if she was OK, but she didn't answer, so her partner took her to the doctor. There, the doctor said that she was OK but she would never hear again unless she paid 1, 000 dollars for an operation.
instance_text.corrected: One day, a man and his wife were trying to find a place that was shallow and without pollution to cultivate. They were poor; they didn't have the necessary resources, but the husband worked so hard because his wife had had an accident. It happened one day that his wife was working on a campaign for the conservation of endangered animals. She went to a place in search of animals. She heard a sound in a dark place in the jungle, so she went to investigate what that was. A creature that had never been seen attacked her. Her partner only heard a shout and they found Lucy, the wife of the man, on the floor. They asked her if she was OK, but she didn't answer, so her partner took her to the doctor. There, the doctor said that she was OK but she would never hear again unless she paid 1, 000 dollars for an operation.

feedback.feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but you are using the present tense.

instance_text.source: Your thoughts are the only ones that will make the difference, so take care only of them and believe in yourself so you could achieve the prestige you're looking for.
instance_text.corrected: Your thoughts are the only ones that will make the difference, so take care only of them and believe in yourself so you can achieve the prestige you're looking for.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Could" is used for the past or hypotheticals. "Can" is better for current ability or possibility.

instance_text.source: Companies can create a site dedicated to introducing the value of the products, prices and services deals.
instance_text.corrected: Companies can create a site dedicated to introducing the value of the products, prices and service deals.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When a noun modifies another noun, it should be in the singular form.

instance_text.source: The periodic movement of the minute hand compared to the smooth path of the seconds hand.
instance_text.corrected: The periodic movement of the minute hand compared to the smooth path of the second hand.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When a noun is used to modify another noun, it should be in the singular.

instance_text.source: First, as we all know, cars play a very important role in our lives, and more and more cars come into our family.
instance_text.corrected: First, as we all know, cars play a very important role in our lives, and more and more cars come into our families.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Family" is singular here, but it seems you are speaking in general.

instance_text.source: We had been told earlier that Abul kaka had got a very nice PAJERO Jeep from the office nonetheless the performance of the vehicle was awful that day.
instance_text.corrected: We had been told earlier that Abul kaka had got a very nice PAJERO Jeep from the office . Nonetheless , the performance of the vehicle was awful that day.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Nonetheless" can't link the two parts of this sentence. Right now, this is a run-on sentence. It must be broken up or connected more smoothly.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider ending the sentence here and starting a new one with "Nonetheless, ..."

instance_text.source: Before 2014, Trivago is not famous in Asia.
instance_text.corrected: Before 2014, Trivago was not famous in Asia.

feedback.feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but you are using the present tense.

instance_text.source: But lucky wasn't with me!
instance_text.corrected: But luck wasn't with me!

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Lucky" is an adjective, but a noun is required here.

instance_text.source: But I love basketball and handball - especially the former - every time when we play basketball at school during Physical Education, I'm so happy about it and I do my best. I don't know how to explain why I love this game so much.
instance_text.corrected: But I love basketball and handball - especially the former - every time [NONE] we play basketball at school during Physical Education, I'm so happy about it and I do my best. I don't know how to explain why I love this game so much.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Either "every time" or "when" can be used here, but not both.

instance_text.source: So you can see nearly all [NONE] Spain in a month and it is very worthwhile, according to my best friend.
instance_text.corrected: So you can see nearly all of Spain in a month and it is very worthwhile, according to my best friend.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "All" is generally followed by "of" when talking about the entirety of a single thing like "Spain."

instance_text.source: As long as I try to keep doing thing in an eco - friendly way, I realize that I am giving a little from my side and I feel I am caring for my environment.
instance_text.corrected: As long as I try to keep doing things in an eco - friendly way, I realize that I am giving a little from my side and I feel I am caring for my environment.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Thing" is singular here, but you are talking about doing more than one thing.

instance_text.source: In my country people make a lot of mistakes and have a lot of of bad habits concerning their attitude towards rubbish. They are always throwing their old things and rubbish away in public places. The government also can not do their role towards their people and their bad behaviour.
instance_text.corrected: In my country people make a lot of mistakes and have a lot of [NONE] bad habits concerning their attitude towards rubbish. They are always throwing their old things and rubbish away in public places. The government also can not do their role towards their people and their bad behaviour.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "of" appears twice. Only one is necessary.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Delete one of the copies of "of."

instance_text.source: What happened to all those words he'd given to me!
instance_text.corrected: What happened to all those words he'd said to me!

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Given" does not sound natural here.

instance_text.source: The Internet has also replaced television to watching films and TV shows, especially among young people, who prefer to download and watch videos instead of watching to the fixed schedule of TV.
instance_text.corrected: The Internet has also replaced television for watching films and TV shows, especially among young people, who prefer to download and watch videos instead of watching to the fixed schedule of TV.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The pattern "for verb (-ing)" can be used to show the purpose or reason something is used.

instance_text.source: One piece of good news is that I finally gave up and bought my first Smartphone.
instance_text.corrected: One piece of good news is that I finally gave in and bought my first Smartphone.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Give up" means to stop trying and does not fit well here. You might be thinking of the phrasal verb "give in," which means to stop resisting.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider using "give in" instead of "give up."

instance_text.source: For example, only 10% percent of the boys never do that and 24% go to nightspots at least once a week.
instance_text.corrected: For example, only 10% [NONE] of the boys never do that and 24% go to nightspots at least once a week.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The symbol "%" means "percent," so you do not need the word "percent" as well.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Remove either "%" or "percent" to fix the redundancy.

instance_text.source: At 2 p.m. my mum decided to go to the hospital because I couldn't understand anything and I ca n't talk.
instance_text.corrected: At 2 p.m. my mum decided to go to the hospital because I couldn't understand anything and I could n't talk.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use "could" for something that was allowed or possible in the past.

instance_text.source: Finally, if you drive a car, you don't have to care about a timetable. You can go at any time.
instance_text.corrected: Finally, if you drive a car, you don't have to worry about a timetable. You can go at any time.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Worry about" may fit here better than "care about." "Worry about" is used for things that cause trouble or stress.

instance_text.source: Also, planting more trees instead of cutting them [NONE] will purify our breathing air and reduce air pollution.
instance_text.corrected: Also, planting more trees instead of cutting them down will purify our breathing air and reduce air pollution.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You may be thinking of the phrasal verb "cut down."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "down" after "them" to complete the phrasal verb.

instance_text.source: Therefore, public transport play an important role in mitigating global warming.
instance_text.corrected: Therefore, public transport plays an important role in mitigating global warming.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "public transport," is third-person singular. The verb must be in a different form to go with it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "play" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: A lot of young mans love wearing jeans and a T - shirt.
instance_text.corrected: A lot of young men love wearing jeans and a T - shirt.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Mans" is not the plural of "man." It has an irregular plural form.

instance_text.source: I think I am right for the position because I think I can boost the motivation of people about movies and push them up to share their particular point of view.
instance_text.corrected: I think I am right for the position because I think I can boost the motivation of people about movies and push them [NONE] to share their particular point of view.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Rather than "push up," it is better to use "push" by itself here to mean "urge."

instance_text.source: The film, directed by Louis Leterrier, is about four magicians, known as 'The Four Horsemen' that are joined together by a mysterious benefactor, and during their presentations they do all kind of illegal stuff, such as robbing a bank or ripping off their own boss.
instance_text.corrected: The film, directed by Louis Leterrier, is about four magicians, known as 'The Four Horsemen' that are joined together by a mysterious benefactor, and during their presentations they do all kinds of illegal stuff, such as robbing a bank or ripping off their own boss.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Kind" is a countable noun, so if you talk about "all" of them, you can't use the singular here.

instance_text.source: 'What are you doing here' ask Alison. He looked at her but with a bad smile, and turn his head.
instance_text.corrected: 'What are you doing here' asked Alison. He looked at her but with a bad smile, and turn his head.

feedback.feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but you are not using a past-tense verb here.

instance_text.source: The immigrants came with this religious culture and with time [NONE] has become part of American culture.
instance_text.corrected: The immigrants came with this religious culture and with time it has become part of American culture.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Your sentence is missing a subject for the verb "has become."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add a noun or pronoun to act as the subject here.

instance_text.source: Tom yelled: 'ladies and gentlemen, please help us as much as you can because all of the income of this show is paid for the surgery of a sick boy'.
instance_text.corrected: Tom yelled: 'ladies and gentlemen, please help us as much as you can because all of the income of this show is paying for the surgery of a sick boy'.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the present continuous tense (am/is/are + the -ing form) to talk about something that is happening now or planned in the near future.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "is paid" to the -ing form to make this the present continuous.

instance_text.source: The good things about not allowing cars in cities centres are that the traffic will be reduced, trips will be faster and the pollution will be reduced.
instance_text.corrected: The good things about not allowing cars in city centres are that the traffic will be reduced, trips will be faster and the pollution will be reduced.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When a noun is used to modify another noun, it should be in the singular.

instance_text.source: As technology develops rather rapidly, it's a world - wide phenomenon now for us to find that large - scale buildings and transport networks are to be built for the sake of human 's economy, which means vast areas of farmland, forest and wetland are on the way to being ruined.
instance_text.corrected: As technology develops rather rapidly, it's a world - wide phenomenon now for us to find that large - scale buildings and transport networks are to be built for the sake of human [NONE] economy, which means vast areas of farmland, forest and wetland are on the way to being ruined.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "human" is enough to modify "workshops" - a possessive is not necessary.

instance_text.source: Nowadays people are using cars a lot.
instance_text.corrected: Nowadays people use cars a lot.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the simple present, not the present continuous, for things that are commonly or usually done.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "are using" to the simple present tense.

instance_text.source: Grass hockey is a popular sport played by people of all ages and it's played more in countries like Britain, Argentina or Germany, than [NONE] Spain or Italy.
instance_text.corrected: Grass hockey is a popular sport played by people of all ages and it's played more in countries like Britain, Argentina or Germany, than in Spain or Italy.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When using "in (place)" in a comparison, the preposition of place must be repeated.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add the word "in" before "Spain or Italy."

instance_text.source: For instance, when I was three years old, I used to be captivated by all the toys which were presented in TV commercials just because [NONE] the way they were presented.
instance_text.corrected: For instance, when I was three years old, I used to be captivated by all the toys which were presented in TV commercials just because of the way they were presented.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Because" needs the preposition "of" when connecting to a noun like "the way."

instance_text.source: My name is Elvira Vergara and I am applying for the job in the summer camp of your advertisement.
instance_text.corrected: My name is Elvira Vergara and I am applying for the job in the summer camp in your advertisement.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Of" is not the best preposition to use here to show where the job was. A preposition of place is needed.

instance_text.source: You can use it to learn any language or take courses in any field from your home for weeks or months if you can. This is named self - study.
instance_text.corrected: You can use it to learn any language or take courses in any field from your home for weeks or months if you can. This is called self - study.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Named" is used when giving someone or something a specific name. "Called" is better when describing what something is generally known as.

instance_text.source: According to the latest studies, pollution increases this year in the biggest cities whereas it has gone down in villages.
instance_text.corrected: According to the latest studies, pollution has increased this year in the biggest cities whereas it has gone down in villages.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When talking about something that started in the past and continues until now, it is necessary to use the present perfect tense (have/has + past participle of the verb).

instance_text.source: There are so many kinds of problems which the environmental pollution causes.
instance_text.corrected: There are so many kinds of problems which [NONE] environmental pollution causes.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Environmental pollution" does not need the article "the" when used in a general sense.

instance_text.source: Besides, we had to watch if the band had everything that they needed: something to eat and to drink. I was responsible for that.
instance_text.corrected: Besides, we had to see if the band had everything that they needed: something to eat and to drink. I was responsible for that.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Watch" usually means to look at something continuously. "See" is better for checking something or finding out information.

instance_text.source: Finally, the word convenient for everyone means something dirrerent.
instance_text.corrected: Finally, the word convenient means something different for everyone.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Prepositional phrases like "for everyone" should come right after the words they modify.

instance_text.source: These are very cheap and people who do not have a car use it to go everywhere. However, this mode of transport is not so comfortable, because sometimes you have to travel with lots of people.
instance_text.corrected: These are very cheap and people who do not have a car use them to go everywhere. However, this mode of transport is not so comfortable, because sometimes you have to travel with lots of people.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "It" seems to refer to "these," but it is singular, so the two do not agree.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "it" to a different pronoun that matches the noun better.

instance_text.source: In the morning, everyone goes to their job by car, but I think that the real reason to doing this is that we need to do a lot of things during the day and with public transport we spend more time than doing the same with our own vehicle.
instance_text.corrected: In the morning, everyone goes to their job by car, but I think that the real reason for doing this is that we need to do a lot of things during the day and with public transport we spend more time than doing the same with our own vehicle.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "To" can't be used with a gerund like "doing." To talk about "doing this" as a goal or purpose, use the pattern "for + gerund."

instance_text.source: Also, I think I would be a good person for the job because I like nature. I could teach them a lot of things about the Geology, a camp is perfect for introducing the boys and girls to stones and minerals.
instance_text.corrected: Also, I think I would be a good person for the job because I like nature. I could teach them a lot of things about [NONE] Geology, a camp is perfect for introducing the boys and girls to stones and minerals.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Geology" is an abstract noun, so it does not need an article here.

instance_text.source: It is not important if these people are friends or family, they can change our lives for better or worse, it depends on you [NONE] choose the best thing that can help you.
instance_text.corrected: It is not important if these people are friends or family, they can change our lives for better or worse, it depends on you to choose the best thing that can help you.

feedback.feedback_explanation: In the phrase "depend on (person) (action)," the action's verb must be in the to-infinitive form.

instance_text.source: The river was flowing down with great noise, and its level was slowly rising up, as had been happening for the last few days.
instance_text.corrected: The river was flowing down with great noise, and its level was slowly rising [NONE], as had been happening for the last few days.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Ten year ago, the local governing body of the city decide to plant more trees and it asked advice from the citizens of the city about the proposal.
instance_text.corrected: Ten year ago, the local governing body of the city decided to plant more trees and it asked advice from the citizens of the city about the proposal.

feedback.feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but you are using the present tense.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "decide" to the past tense form.

instance_text.source: Many people say that they are preferring using their own cars, but they are being forced to use public transport for many reasons, such as, the complications they face with the driver's license, in addition to the high cost of fuel.
instance_text.corrected: Many people say that they prefer using their own cars, but they are being forced to use public transport for many reasons, such as, the complications they face with the driver's license, in addition to the high cost of fuel.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When describing something people generally do, use the simple present, not the present continuous.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "are preferring" to the simple present form.

instance_text.source: I used to run summer camps and art 's workshops.
instance_text.corrected: I used to run summer camps and art [NONE] workshops.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "art" is enough to modify "workshops" - a possessive is not necessary.

instance_text.source: The roots of Parkour was developed by him and he taught some Parkour techniques to the firemen who he used to work with.
instance_text.corrected: The roots of Parkour were developed by him and he taught some Parkour techniques to the firemen who he used to work with.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "the roots of Parkour," is plural, but "was" can only be used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "was" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: If you ask someone about the future, the answers will be different, but all will be around two main topics, they will be either optimist the about future or pessimistic about the future.
instance_text.corrected: If you ask someone about the future, the answers will be different, but all will be around two main topics, they will be either optimistic the about future or pessimistic about the future.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Optimist" is a noun, but an adjective is necessary here to describe people.

instance_text.source: It bring unity between countries.
instance_text.corrected: It brings unity between countries.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "it," is third-person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "bring" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: It's more comfortable, faster and preferable to having to run to catch a bus, wait [NONE] a train, etc.
instance_text.corrected: It's more comfortable, faster and preferable to having to run to catch a bus, wait for a train, etc.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When used transitively like this, "wait" needs a preposition to connect to its object.

instance_text.source: The first advantage is that the Internet is very quick. For example, when you want information about something.
instance_text.corrected: The first advantage is that the Internet is very fast. For example, when you want information about something.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Quick" is used for short actions or moments, while "fast" is better for describing speed in general, like internet speed.

instance_text.source: Their names is Pluto, Krocken and Zelda.
instance_text.corrected: Their names are Pluto, Krocken and Zelda.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "names," is plural. However, "is" can only be used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: There is another issue that is due to heavy traffic but little bit roads that are wide enough so that most people are distributed due to these issues.
instance_text.corrected: There is another issue that is due to heavy traffic but few roads that are wide enough so that most people are distributed due to these issues.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Little bit" can't be used for the amount of something countable like "roads."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Use another word to express the amount, such as "few."

instance_text.source: When you practise any sport, you have to be confident in yourself, without confidence you will not have any progress.
instance_text.corrected: When you do any sport, you have to be confident in yourself, without confidence you will not have any progress.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Practise" is not the most natural word to use with "sport." "Do" and "play" are more common.

instance_text.source: The professor, however, doesn't think so because the designs of the stone balls are too simple to show the important social status.
instance_text.corrected: The professor, however, doesn't think so because the designs of the stone balls are too simple to show an important social status.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Consider using a different article here. "Important social status" is not specific, so it should use an indefinite article.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "the" to "a" to refer to something that is not specific.

instance_text.source: He thought it would be good to [NONE] distracted for a while.
instance_text.corrected: He thought it would be good to be distracted for a while.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Distracted" can't be used directly after "to" in a to-infinitive. The verb "be" is necessary as well.

instance_text.source: Firstly, studying is very difficult because you have to accept new ways of studying - studying by myself.
instance_text.corrected: Firstly, studying is very difficult because you have to accept new ways of studying - studying by yourself.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "You" is used earlier in the sentence to make it into general advice, and "myself" does not fit with that.

instance_text.source: We left our city on Monday, and we arrived [NONE] Carlos Paz on Thursday.
instance_text.corrected: We left our city on Monday, and we arrived in Carlos Paz on Thursday.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use a preposition of place, such as "at" or "in," to show where an action like "arrive" happens.

instance_text.source: He taught me my basic English, to play tennis, to play the guitar, to dance, to sing and I can continue counting.
instance_text.corrected: He taught me my basic English, to play tennis, to play the guitar, to dance, to sing and I could go on.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The phrasing of "I can continue counting" is a little unnatural. Perhaps you are thinking of the similar phrase "I could go on."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider changing this to "I could go on."

instance_text.source: He also cooks tasty meals and give me them.
instance_text.corrected: He also cooks tasty meals and gives me them.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "he," is third-person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "give" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: Tired of having their house destroyed, the landlords decided to build a new house on the hill, so they wouldn't be bothered by floods anymore.
instance_text.corrected: Tired of having their houses destroyed, the landlords decided to build a new house on the hill, so they wouldn't be bothered by floods anymore.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: And they will also remind you about some key points you didn't understand when you preview it.
instance_text.corrected: And they will also remind you about some key points you didn't understand when you previewed it.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: Finally, you can enjoy the museum with all the family and you can invite some people from other city or other countries.
instance_text.corrected: Finally, you can enjoy the museum with all the family and you can invite some people from other cities or other countries.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "City" is singular here, but you seem to be talking about various different ones.

instance_text.source: Residents in Hong Kong are enjoying a high level of freedom in religion, speech, organizational, activities, going abroad during their life.
instance_text.corrected: Residents in Hong Kong are enjoying a high level of freedom in religion, speech, organization, activities, going abroad during their life.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "organizational" is an adjective, but we need a noun here.

instance_text.source: However, this is also an opportunity to meet up and work with them every week people for whom English is their first language, to improve my oral communication skills and persuasion.
instance_text.corrected: However, this is also an opportunity to meet up and work every week with people for whom English is their first language, to improve my oral communication skills and persuasion.

report: Data/format issues (e.g., misalignment, odd symbols).

instance_text.source: They are very happy with me, because my marks is good.
instance_text.corrected: They are very happy with me, because my marks are good.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "marks" is plural, but "is" can only be used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: Nowadays, travelling by car is much more common than we could ever imagine.
instance_text.corrected: Nowadays, travelling by car is much more common than we could ever have imagined.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When discussing hypothetical past actions, the present perfect tense ("have" + the past participle) is used.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Chance "imagine" to its present perfect form.

instance_text.source: Some may say that we do not need public transport anymore in the future.
instance_text.corrected: Some may say that we will not need public transport anymore in the future.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You seem to be talking about the future, but you are not using a future tense verb here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "do not need" to the future tense.

instance_text.source: I will have to compassion to not be a bully and the courage to not to be a bystander.
instance_text.corrected: I will have [NONE] compassion to not be a bully and the courage to not to be a bystander.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The verb "have" does not need a preposition to connect to its object.

instance_text.source: However, I do not agree with them, because in most parts of the world mass transport systems are still popular and they are environment friendly and cost - efficient.
instance_text.corrected: However, I do not agree with them, because in most parts of the world mass transport systems are still popular and they are environmentally friendly and cost - efficient.

feedback.feedback_explanation: An adverb is needed to modify "friendly," but "environment" is an adjective.

instance_text.source: Suddenly two people dressed as astronauts were leaving the park and warned the young boys to go to their house and wait until this unfortunately event was over.
instance_text.corrected: Suddenly two people dressed as astronauts were leaving the park and warned the young boys to go to their house and wait until this unfortunate event was over.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Unfortunately" is an adverb, but it seems to be modifying "event." An adjective should be used instead.

instance_text.source: I do believe that people's lives in the future will change for the bad.
instance_text.corrected: I do believe that people's lives in the future will change for the worse.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "For the bad" is comparing the present and future. It should use the comparative form of the word "bad."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "bad" to "worse" to fix this comparative phrase.

instance_text.source: Surprisingly, the producer get to maintain his profits due to the proportional decrease in price as well as the cost to produce.
instance_text.corrected: Surprisingly, the producer gets to maintain his profits due to the proportional decrease in price as well as the cost to produce.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "the producer," is in the third person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "get" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: During those few times through which I built [NONE] my experience, we all played together and we cooked together, so I taught them how to make some chicken and some pasta in the Italian way.
instance_text.corrected: During those few times through which I built up my experience, we all played together and we cooked together, so I taught them how to make some chicken and some pasta in the Italian way.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Build" does not fit here on its own. Perhaps you are thinking of the phrasal verb "build up," meaning "to increase over time."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "up" here to complete the phrasal verb.

instance_text.source: It is a fact that the public transport is getting worse year by year, especially here in Peru , however we have to think about the benefits that public transport has. For instance, it can be a cost - effective way to get to work. So, will there be no place for public transport in the future?
instance_text.corrected: It is a fact that the public transport is getting worse year by year, especially here in Peru . However , we have to think about the benefits that public transport has. For instance, it can be a cost - effective way to get to work. So, will there be no place for public transport in the future?

feedback.feedback_explanation: This is a run-on sentence. It should be separated into shorter sentences.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider ending the sentence here and starting a new one with "However, ..."

instance_text.source: We think that it will be convenient for him to apply [NONE] a Postdoc position during his military service.
instance_text.corrected: We think that it will be convenient for him to apply for a Postdoc position during his military service.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Apply" needs a preposition to connect to an object like "position."

instance_text.source: Peter thought that he must do something quickly to avoid her from committing suicide.
instance_text.corrected: Peter thought that he must do something quickly to prevent her from committing suicide.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Avoid" means stopping oneself from doing something or keeping away from something. "Prevent" is better for stopping someone else.

instance_text.source: But after the first song, when the audience started to sing and dance, our manager came to us and told us that we can go see the concert.
instance_text.corrected: But after the first song, when the audience started to sing and dance, our manager came to us and told us that we could go see the concert.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use "could" for something that was allowed or possible in the past.

instance_text.source: She has twenty - seven maid of honor dresses. Meanwhile, she falls in love with a boy who is very handsome, but he is working for a magazine and he has written about weddings in the city. He is a good writer, and she unknowns that.
instance_text.corrected: She has twenty - seven maid of honor dresses. Meanwhile, she falls in love with a boy who is very handsome, but he works for a magazine and he has written about weddings in the city. He is a good writer, and she unknowns that.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Since Michael was a child he had always dreamt of moving to Australia, where he could practise kitesurfing all day long, meet open - minded people, chill on a sandy beach and drink good Australian alcohol.
instance_text.corrected: Since Michael was a child he had always dreamt of moving to Australia, where he could go kitesurfing all day long, meet open - minded people, chill on a sandy beach and drink good Australian alcohol.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: On 3th March 2014, a survey was conducted among 60 students.
instance_text.corrected: On 3rd March 2014, a survey was conducted among 60 students.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The number 3 uses the ending "rd" when used as an ordinal.

instance_text.source: The result depend on: confidence, volume of the voice, body posture and audience.
instance_text.corrected: The result depends on: confidence, volume of the voice, body posture and audience.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "result," is third-person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "depend" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: What a gargantuan sacrifice of self - esteem and reputation they had made!
instance_text.corrected: What a gargantuan sacrifice of self - esteem and reputation they [NONE] made!

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: On the other hand, near [NONE] Mediterranean Sea there are a lot of towns with fantastic beaches where the water is very clean and warm.
instance_text.corrected: On the other hand, near the Mediterranean Sea there are a lot of towns with fantastic beaches where the water is very clean and warm.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You are missing the article "the" before "Mediterranean Sea." The names of seas and oceans usually include "the."

instance_text.source: My town makes great efforts to take care of the environment. They have put many bins in the streets to keep it clean and they prevent private transport on many days to keep the air clean. They plant trees to absorb co2 and release oxygen, they build factories away from the houses of citizens to prevent the respiratory diseases which is a result of air pollution from factories. So, not only my country itself but also individuals follow a proper procedure to keep the environment clean.
instance_text.corrected: My town makes great efforts to take care of the environment. They have put many bins in the streets to keep it clean and they prevent private transport on many days to keep the air clean. They plant trees to absorb co2 and release oxygen, they build factories away from the houses of citizens to prevent the respiratory diseases which are a result of air pollution from factories. So, not only my country itself but also individuals follow a proper procedure to keep the environment clean.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "respiratory diseases" is plural, but "is" can only be used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: It will be very good to us, for the animals and for all the plants.
instance_text.corrected: It will be very good for us, for the animals and for all the plants.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When mentioning who something is good for, the preposition "for" is needed. Use the pattern "be (adjective) for (person)."

instance_text.source: For example, I can watch a lot of matches a day and I enjoy it when I watch famous players such [NONE] Cristiano Ronaldo for Real Madrid and Messy for Barcelona.
instance_text.corrected: For example, I can watch a lot of matches a day and I enjoy it when I watch famous players such as Cristiano Ronaldo for Real Madrid and Messy for Barcelona.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The phrase "such as" is used to give examples.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "as" to make this into "such as."

instance_text.source: Quite often, I found it difficult to balance both my study and my hobbies at the same time.
instance_text.corrected: Quite often, I found it difficult to balance both my studies and my hobbies at the same time.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Study" should be plural here, not singular. Sometimes, "study" is an uncountable noun, but it is countable when talking about one's various efforts.

instance_text.source: With the advance of technology, a lot of problems have come to pass. Natural resources are becoming in storted, and the air pollution is getting worse.
instance_text.corrected: With the advance of technology, a lot of problems have arisen. Natural resources are becoming in storted, and the air pollution is getting worse.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Nevertheless, learning another language has many benefits, such as the ability in live in and visit countries with different languages, meeting foreign people, working in an international environment, reading books or websites in other languages, etc.
instance_text.corrected: Nevertheless, learning another language has many benefits, such as the ability to live in and visit countries with different languages, meeting foreign people, working in an international environment, reading books or websites in other languages, etc.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Ability" needs a to-infinitive (to + base form of the verb) here. It does not use the word "in."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "in" to "to" to make this a to-infinitive.

instance_text.source: I had been learning English for the last six months.
instance_text.corrected: I have been learning English for the last six months.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When talking about something that started in the past and continues until now, it is necessary to use the present perfect tense.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "had" to its present form to make this into a present perfect verb.

instance_text.source: I definitely recommend that album to your collection.
instance_text.corrected: I definitely recommend that album for your collection.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The preposition "for" is used with nouns to show why something is done.

instance_text.source: Another idea is riding a bicycle and walking street.
instance_text.corrected: Another idea is riding a bicycle and walking [NONE].

feedback.feedback_explanation: The purpose of "street" is not clear in this sentence.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider removing "street" or adding more to the sentence to clarify why it is there.

instance_text.source: First, when I was on the starting line, I felt I could not finish the competition. Then, when we were in the water the coaches did not stop encouraging us so it was easy to swim to the finishing line. I was so excited to see our family waiting for us, clapping and shouting loudly every time one of us arrived.
instance_text.corrected: First, when I was on the starting line, I felt I could not finish the competition. Then, when we were in the water the coaches did not stop encouraging us so it was easy to swim to the finishing line. I was so excited to see our families waiting for us, clapping and shouting loudly every time one of us arrived.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Family" is uncountable when talking about one family, but it is countable and should be plural if there is more than one family in this situation.

instance_text.source: Using your own car, you can take the decision of what timetable is more convenient and what route your are going to use.
instance_text.corrected: Using your own car, you can take the decision of what timetable is more convenient and what route you are going to use.

feedback.feedback_explanation: This word may be misspelled.

instance_text.source: My country was attacked by Russia.
instance_text.corrected: My country has been attacked by Russia.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: Nowadays, we really focus on how we can extract this energy, but not on other important things, like the way that we can start to use it, the correct use that we could make [NONE] it or how we can reuse the energy.
instance_text.corrected: Nowadays, we really focus on how we can extract this energy, but not on other important things, like the way that we can start to use it, the correct use that we could make of it or how we can reuse the energy.

feedback.feedback_explanation: This seems to be the phrase "make use of," but the word "of" is missing.

instance_text.source: I'm so excited to spending these weeks with you and I'm really looking forward to meeting Eileen.
instance_text.corrected: I'm so excited about spending these weeks with you and I'm really looking forward to meeting Eileen.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Excited" uses either "about (noun/gerund)" or a to-infinitive, but here you have "excited to" with the gerund "spending."

instance_text.source: It's what's inside that count.
instance_text.corrected: It's what's inside that counts.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "what," is in the third person singular, so the verb must be in a different form to match it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "count" to the third-person singular form.

instance_text.source: While designing fun activities, the camp workers have to take into concerns the safety level of those activities, the possible harm and the protection and treatment supplies that might be needed.
instance_text.corrected: While designing fun activities, the camp workers have to take into account the safety level of those activities, the possible harm and the protection and treatment supplies that might be needed.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Concerns" is not usually used with "take into." You may be thinking of the phrase "take into account."

instance_text.source: He was worried that the bird charged him, so the man seeks refuge and goes in a cave.
instance_text.corrected: He was worried that the bird might charge him, so the man seeks refuge and goes in a cave.

feedback.feedback_explanation: It seems like this is a hypothetical situation, but "charged" is in the simple past tense. Instead, a modal verb like "might" or "could" must be used, followed by the base form of the verb.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "charged" to a hypothetical version with a modal, such as "might charge."

instance_text.source: Mohammed was a kindly prophet born in a small city called Mekka and he travelled to another city close to Mekka called Almadina because the people of Mekka were very aggressive and they did not accepted the new invitation to the new religion.
instance_text.corrected: Mohammed was a kindly prophet born in a small city called Mekka and he travelled to another city close to Mekka called Almadina because the people of Mekka were very aggressive and they did not accept the new invitation to the new religion.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When using a verb in the past with "did not," the verb itself should be in the base form.

instance_text.source: If I also had a year free, I would only prefer travel, not work.
instance_text.corrected: If I also had a year free, I would only want to travel, not work.

report: Data/format issues (e.g., misalignment, odd symbols).

instance_text.source: The focus on children can be found in the huge contribution the Kids Club has to the daily life in the hotel.
instance_text.corrected: The focus on children can be found in the huge contribution the Kids Club makes to the daily life in the hotel.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Contribution" is usually used with the verb "make," not "have."

instance_text.source: So, in my opinion, children when they are witness always want to help strangers.
instance_text.corrected: So, in my opinion, children when they are witnesses always want to help strangers.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Witness" is singular, but since you mention the plural word "children," this should be plural too.

instance_text.source: So, my bills for water are inexpensive, because I have swapped having a bath to take a shower.
instance_text.corrected: So, my bills for water are inexpensive, because I have swapped having a bath to taking a shower.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The action "take" is being used like a noun here, so it must be changed to a gerund.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "take" to the -ing form to make it a gerund.

instance_text.source: When both of them started to search [NONE] clues around the house, they didn't find anything interesting, but after a while, they had seen several paw prints and, at that moment, Michael remembered a fact: he had left his dog inside the house, but the puppy had disappeared!
instance_text.corrected: When both of them started to search for clues around the house, they didn't find anything interesting, but after a while, they had seen several paw prints and, at that moment, Michael remembered a fact: he had left his dog inside the house, but the puppy had disappeared!

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Search" needs a preposition to connect to its object "clues."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "for" after "search" to connect these words.

instance_text.source: No matter where a famous person goes, he must realize that, next day, he will be on the first page of the newspapers with lots of rumours.
instance_text.corrected: No matter where a famous person goes, he must realize that, next day, he will be on the front page of the newspapers with lots of rumours.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: When you have finished your studies and you have gotten a job where where you do the same activities every day, the brain doesn't work hard and you might have some problems like forget words, dates, information that you learnt a few years ago, because your memory won't work in the same way.
instance_text.corrected: When you have finished your studies and you have gotten a job where where you do the same activities every day, the brain doesn't work hard and you might have some problems like forgetting words, dates, information that you learnt a few years ago, because your memory won't work in the same way.

feedback.feedback_explanation: In this situation, "Forget" is being used as a noun, so its form must be changed to a gerund.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "forget" to a gerund by using the -ing form.

instance_text.source: Public transport offers a range of timetables for trains, buses or metro, but when it comes to deal with the day - to - day tasks, we very often find travelling in our own car is the easiest way.
instance_text.corrected: Public transport offers a range of timetables for trains, buses or metro, but when it comes to dealing with the day - to - day tasks, we very often find travelling in our own car is the easiest way.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Deal" is being used as a noun in this situation, so its form must be changed.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Use the gerund (the -ing form) to make this verb work as a noun.

instance_text.source: First of all, I strongly believe that I would be the most suitable applicant because of my long experience in bar servicing.
instance_text.corrected: First of all, I strongly believe that I would be the most suitable applicant because of my long experience in bar service.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Bar servicing" does not sound natural here.

instance_text.source: The consciousness that a change is needed to create a better place for people to live [NONE] should be raised first.
instance_text.corrected: The consciousness that a change is needed to create a better place for people to live in should be raised first.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: I can't believe that we keep in touch with our family and friends not only by voice and message but also [NONE] video call now.
instance_text.corrected: I can't believe that we keep in touch with our family and friends not only by voice and message but also by video call now.

feedback.feedback_explanation: A preposition is needed before "video call" to show it is how something is done.

instance_text.source: It seems that the most popular sport in the whole world is football because it keep all people united, so that is why I love this sport and not only because of that, but it makes me feel very excited and it involves a lot of emotion as well. Do you enjoy watching or playing football?
instance_text.corrected: It seems that the most popular sport in the whole world is football because it keeps all people united, so that is why I love this sport and not only because of that, but it makes me feel very excited and it involves a lot of emotion as well. Do you enjoy watching or playing football?

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "it," is third-person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "keep" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: But the engineer ignore this situation. Then a helicopter came to save the residents.
instance_text.corrected: But the engineer ignored this situation. Then a helicopter came to save the residents.

feedback.feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but you are not using a past-tense verb here.

instance_text.source: From the 1980's, it is developed as an international financial centre and so many global investors have set up their headquarters there.
instance_text.corrected: From the 1980's, it has been developed as an international financial centre and so many global investors have set up their headquarters there.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When talking about something that started in the past and continues until now, the present perfect tense is necessary.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "is developed" to the present perfect.

instance_text.source: On top [NONE] that, I think the amount of notice you have given people is unreasonable.
instance_text.corrected: On top of that, I think the amount of notice you have given people is unreasonable.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The correct phrasing for this expression is "on top of that."

instance_text.source: One thing leads to another and we ended up having a beer and laughing in a pub.
instance_text.corrected: One thing led to another and we ended up having a beer and laughing in a pub.

feedback.feedback_explanation: This seems to have happened in the past, but "leads" is not in a past-tense form.

instance_text.source: What I liked most was that you think you know what is going to happen, but for your surprise, it always turns out to be something unexpected.
instance_text.corrected: What I liked most was that you think you know what is going to happen, but to your surprise, it always turns out to be something unexpected.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The correct expression is "to (one's) surprise."

instance_text.source: Moreover, I need to improve my skills, such as reading, listening, writing, and speaking. They help me to keep up on my teacher's lessons.
